content.description:
A serious route with strenuous and technical climbing requiring gear placement on the hard sections. The route is based on the discontinuous cracks which angle slightly leftwards up the left center of the face.

P1. Widely spaced bolts up scoops left of the feature to athletic committing laybacking up a thin seam rightwards to the anchor.

P2. The upper pitch is a better-formed crack but deceptively hard.
content.protection: Small stuff for P1, a full single rack up to hands for P2.
content.location: The route is based on the discontinuous cracks which angle slightly leftwards up the left center of the face.

content.description: The first pitch at the crag follows the crack line with gear and bolts, traversing left at the top to the same belay used for World Line. Rappel or continue up World Line.
content.location: This starts in the sort-of-crack left of center of the main wall.

content.description: Crcks with some tenuous laybacking at the crux.
content.protection: Mostly draws, but there may be a bit of gear.
content.location: This is more or less directly below the upper crack of World Line.
A little to the right of PBW. Starts at the same point as Guevedoces.

content.description: Climb up a line of weakness with sparse gear angling right up high to a two bolt belay. There are two or three bolts on this pitch somewhere, one protecting the crux section to the anchor in the middle of the wall. Rappel or climb a significantly harder route to the top.
content.location: Starts in the center-ish of the wall.

content.description:
P1. 11c. Start in the futuristic Lake District Chimney. Climb out left onto the main face, past a bolt, and go up near its right side via a vague crack in parts. I think I remember a sketchy #3 Friend in the mix together with some nuts and a couple more fixed points. This pitch ends at the ledge stance of Chert Albert.

P2. 12a. Common with Chert Albert.

P3. 11d. Tricky up the corner then through the left side of a small roof and up a thin crack. Off-route bolt on the right at the roof.
content.protection: Take a single rack, including a #3 Friend.

content.description:
Finds its way up the middle of the wall.

P1. 10d. As for Guevedoces.

P2. 12b. Angle up and leftwards across the impressive headwall.
content.protection: A single rack up to thin hand size, narrow runners for chert, draws.
content.location: Towards the left side of the main wall is the most obvious line on the wall - discontinuous cracks angling slightly leftwards all the way up. Drama Queen starts to the right of this.

content.description:
1. 11c. Climb a face with bolts angling slightly right to a 2 bolt belay.

This pitch can be done as a route in its own right.

2. 12a. A short pitch to a ledge. A little sporty if you just clip the fixed stuff. There is one small piece of gear you can use too if you need to. If you're feeling ambitious you can run P1 and P2 together for the full Bear Creek effect, per the FA..

3. 12b. Angle leftwards across the steep headwall.
content.location: This starts just to the right of Drama Queen.

content.description: The first route left of World Line.
